intro: Girardinia chingianae, commonly known as the Chingia barbet, is a species of freshwater fish native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyprinidae, which includes minnows and carps. The fish is characterized by its elongated body and distinctive coloration, featuring a combination of silver and dark markings. It is typically found in rivers and streams with clear, fast-flowing water. Due to habitat degradation, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
